entry.title: Rabbit
entry.content: About RabbitRabbit is about sharing your everyday. Watch your favorite shows with your friends, without being in the same room (or even the same city!). Collaborate with your coworkers when youâ€™re all on the road. Shop together for a birthday present for Mom, then sing her â€œhappy birthdayâ€ with family far away. The possibilities are endless.Rabbit started with an idea: people sharing experiences online from wherever they are. We began with an app for Mac in February 2013. Then in August 2014 we launched a web-based version of Rabbit. In February 2015, we were named one of the Top 10 Most Innovative Companies in Video by Fast Company. And in October 2015, we launched an app for iOS. But this is only the start: weâ€™ve got big plans.Sounds interesting? Then check out our Careers pageâ€”we might have a spot for you. What are Rabbitâ€™s minimum requirements?Web Browsers The latest, stable version of Chrome, Firefox, or OperaSafari and Microsoft Edge are NOT supported Mobile Devices Rabbit for iOS on iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad iOS 10, and 11. Download the iOS app from the App Store.Rabbit for Android on Android smartphones and tablets Android OS 4.4 or newer. Download the Android app from the Google Play Store. Recommended SpeedsInternet speed required to run Rabbit depends on what youâ€™re doing inside Rabbit. Youâ€™ll need at least a 3 Mbps download / 1 Mbps upload connection. If you plan on having multiple A/V streams in your chat, or using the HD setting to watch the Rabbitcast, youâ€™ll need a stronger connection. Hereâ€™s a breakdown: Share video/audio: 1 Mbps uploadView someone elseâ€™s video/audio: 0.5 Mbps download per personWatch the Rabbitcast: 3 Mbps downloadCheck your connection at speedtest.netDoing things on your network like downloading files or having multiple people/devices on your network uses a lot of bandwidth, so if your Rabbitcast lags, we recommend stopping any downloads running in the background. Youâ€™ll also need a stable connection. Even if your connection seems stable, you may experience issues with Rabbit if your network drops or is otherwise unstable (often caused by low bandwidth). ğŸ’¡ Tip: Are you on iOS or Android? A WiFi connection is preferred over cellular data for stability. (Your mobile data connection may fluctuate a lot and not be as stable as WiFi.) Tips to increase your internet speedSwitch from data to WiFi for a more stable connectionRestart your router (the box your internet plugs into)Move closer to your routerWire in directly using an ethernet cordClose programs on your computer youâ€™re not currently using What browsers does Rabbit support (and why)?Rabbit is currently optimized to be used on the following web browsers: ChromeFirefoxOpera These browsers all support WebRTC, the technology we use for audio and video. Also, they keep up to date with the latest changes in WebRTC with each update. Meet the minimum requirements, but still having issues? A stable connection is also required, as network drops and low bandwidth can negatively impact your Rabbit experience. If you have any questions (or would like to request that we support your device / browser), shoot us a message at help@rabb.it. é‚£ä¹ˆä½ éœ€è¦åšä»€ä¹ˆ é¦–å…ˆä½ è¦æ³¨å†Œ https://www.rabb.it ï¼ˆGoogleï¼ŒFacebookå‡å¯ç›´æ¥ç™»å…¥ï¼‰ï¼› ç„¶åå®ƒä¼šåˆ†é…ä¸€ä¸ªæˆ¿é—´ç»™ä½ ï¼› ç›´æ¥ç™»å…¥å°±å¯ä»¥è®¿é—®ï¼Œåœ¨å³ä¸Šè§’ä¸ªäººå¤´åƒç‚¹ä¸€ä¸‹å°±ä¼šå‡ºæ¥My roomï¼Œå¦‚æœæ²¡å‡ºæ¥ï¼Œä½ é€€å‡ºæ¸¸è§ˆå™¨ï¼Œé‡å¯å³å¯ï¼ˆæ³¨æ„ï¼šè²Œä¼¼æ‰“å­—ï¼Œçœ‹è§†é¢‘æœ‰ç‚¹å¡é¡¿ï¼Œå»¶è¿Ÿæ¯•ç«Ÿæ˜¯ç¾å›½è¿‡æ¥çš„ï¼Œå°†å°±è¿˜æ˜¯å¯ä»¥çœ‹çœ‹çš„ï¼Œå€¼å¾—ä¸€è¯´çš„æ˜¯å®ƒçš„ä¸‹è½½é€Ÿåº¦çœŸçš„æ˜¯å¿«åˆ°ä¸è¡Œï¼‰ï¼› æ³¨æ„æœ€å¥½ä½¿ç”¨chrome49ä»¥ä¸Šç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼› æ€»ä¹‹ï¼Œç©ç©è¿˜æ˜¯å¯ä»¥çš„ï¼Œå˜»å˜»ï¼Œå…¶å®å®ƒä¸æ­¢å¯ä»¥ç§‘å­¦ä¸Šç½‘è¿˜æœ‰å…¶ä»–çš„åŠŸèƒ½å‘¢ï¼æœŸå¾…ä½ ä»¬çš„å‘æ˜ã€‚

entry.title: Hexo github
entry.content: Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub. Quick StartCreate a new post1$ hexo new "My New Post" More info: Writing Run server1$ hexo server More info: Server Generate static files1$ hexo generate More info: Generating Deploy to remote sites1$ hexo deploy More info: Deployment
